name: 1,1':4',1''-Terphenyl
Reason: 1,1':4',1''-Terphenyl has a melting point of 205°C, which is significantly higher than the melting point of benzene (5.5°C). This is due to the presence of two additional phenyl rings, which increase the molecular weight and enhance the pi-pi interactions, leading to a higher melting point.
